body_html:
@ezyang more specifically, we were building and linking against the correct libshm, but when compiling torch-python we unconditionally put torch/lib/libshm in the include path, even on windows.

It turns out that that manifests in some really weird and indirect ways.
body_text:
@ezyang more specifically, we were building and linking against the correct libshm, but when compiling torch-python we unconditionally put torch/lib/libshm in the include path, even on windows.
It turns out that that manifests in some really weird and indirect ways.
body:
@ezyang more specifically, we were building and linking against the correct libshm, but when compiling torch-python we unconditionally put `torch/lib/libshm` in the include path, even on windows.

It turns out that that manifests in some really weird and indirect ways.
